jdbcService.sql: select * from ~accounts a join ~users u on a.id = u.id join ~nodes n on u.id = n.id join ~user_groups ug on ug.user_id = u.id join ~group_roles gr on gr.group_id = ug.group_id -- if the user is coupled without a context, it definitely does not fall within your domain unless you have global access and then this service is useless join ~nodes context on context.id = gr.node_id where context.path like :contextId || '%' and (:q is null or lower(u.alias) like '%' || lower(:q) || '%' or lower(a.given_name) like '%' || lower(:q) || '%' or lower(a.family_name) like '%' || lower(:q) || '%' or lower(a.phone_number) like '%' || lower(:q) || '%' or lower(a.email) like '%' || lower(:q) || '%' ) and (:realm is null or u.realm = any(:realm))
